titleproper.value:
Guide to the Sidney Kaufman Papers
                    <num>ALBA.058</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Wendy Scheir

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-28T16:29-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Sidney Kaufman served in the International Brigades in Spain from July 1937 through February 1939. Kaufman later served in World War II transporting troops in the South Pacific. He was a lifelong member of the Marine Cooks and Stewards Union and the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union. The collection contains Kaufman's correspondence, mementos, military documents, and newspaper articles, primarily dating from his time in Spain.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Elizabeth C. Compa, "Sid Kaufman's Odyssey out of Spain," The Volunteer, June 2005.</item>
                </list>

This collection consists of letters and postcards from Kaufman to his parents and others, as well as letters to Kaufman in Spain; military orders (the bulk of which are in Spanish); newspaper articles; propaganda of the International Brigades and the Partit Socialista Unificat (P.S.U.), including a pop-up card; a fascist propaganda leaflet; and other items. Of particular note is a journal Kaufman kept during the period when he was searching for a way out of Spain. Kaufman's scrapbook, located at the end of the collection, contains items from the Spanish Civil War, including letters, postcards, newspaper articles, stamps, tickets, and other mementos. Material from World War II includes a V-Mail with a cartoon by Spanish Civil War veteran Vincent Lossowski and clippings about Lossowski and other International Brigades veterans in World War II.

corpname.value: Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. Brigada Internacional, XV.
